In 2019 Witney STW works dumped sewage into Curbridge Ditch on 76 separate occasions for a total of 1,396 hours, that's the equivalent of 58 whole days or over 1 day per week. "Exceptional circumstances"? I really don't think so. @OxMailLiamRice

tweets.text: Visit https://t.co/JJIcU3M5dy to keep up to date and feed into our plans with @eaststaffsbc and @EnvAgencyMids to deliver the #WashlandsVision. We will be carrying out ground investigations in January to help inform the plans. https://t.co/bKoBqg9JMa

We attended a pollution near #Grantham, oil from a domestic oil tank leaked into a watercourse. 

Domestic oil tanks need to be maintained and inspected regularly by a qualified person. 

If you suspect your tank is leaking report it to 0800 807060.  https://t.co/2wcZeNOv4J https://t.co/KKthFM5yVw

I‚Äôm taking part in the @Waterwise #Pledge2021, which launched this week, because individual actions do make a difference to national water supplies (many puddles make a river) and it saves money. You can sign up at https://t.co/BwFFnosxkZ @EnvAgency https://t.co/k3Qcod8aVV

tweets.text: Temporary Barrier now removed from#South Hinksey by field teams today,cleaned and put away for future use.Well done to all involved.#TeamEA .@MarkHill03 @EnvAgencySE @wifo_ea @johncurtinEA
@Dazzlalfc81 Hi, please report this to our incident hotline on 0800 807060 so that we can take additional details and investigate. Thanks

A large jack up barge left the River Hull today after being used for 2 years to install 650m of piling as part of the ¬£62.4 million project to improve the defences.

The project will better protect more than 60,000 homes and businesses in #Hull from #flooding. https://t.co/mSz0MNyagO

Well done to @WarrenWhyteUK for raising the issue of the @EnvAgency late warnings of the recent floods in Buckingham at this morning's @BucksCouncil Cabinet. We need to have a clear explanation for what went wrong.

@JonathanGormle6 @DaveThroupEA @AfonyddCymru @theriverstrust @TheRiverSevern @EnvAgencyMids @NatResWales @ChrisBaingerEA @SevernUnlocked @NaturalEngland @AnglingTrust You've given this some thought - flood mitigation, habitat provision, removal of barriers to fish migration. You've pretty much just described the job üôÇ

@severnrivers @DaveThroupEA @AfonyddCymru @theriverstrust @TheRiverSevern @EnvAgencyMids @NatResWales @ChrisBaingerEA @SevernUnlocked @NaturalEngland @AnglingTrust I‚Äôd love too but we need to concentrate on rising river levels and especially on the Severn we need to create fry river beds to cope with flooding and why not redesign the weirs to lower when heavy rain is on the way

@HawfordFarm @severnrivers @AfonyddCymru @theriverstrust @TheRiverSevern @DaveThroupEA @EnvAgencyMids @NatResWales @ChrisBaingerEA @SevernUnlocked @NaturalEngland @AnglingTrust Was looking good until I got to, ‚ÄúFriendly and approachable‚Äù ü§£üòÇü§∑üèº‚Äç‚ôÇÔ∏è
